elementTemplate:
{{ element.Z }}

{{ element.symbol }}

{{ element.electronConfigurationShort }}

{{ element.electronConfiguration }}

    {% for i in element.electronsPerPeriod %}
  • {{ i }}
    • {% endfor %}

elementsOri.name: Hydrogen
elementsOri.origin: composed of the Greek elements hydro- and -gen meaning 'water-forming'

elementsOri.name: Oxygen
elementsOri.origin: from the Greek oxy-, both 'sharp' and 'acid', and -gen, meaning 'acid-forming'

elementsOri.name: Sodium
elementsOri.origin: the English word soda (natrium in Latin)[3]

elementsOri.name: Magnesium
elementsOri.origin: Magnesia, a district of Eastern Thessaly in Greece

elementsOri.name: Scandium
elementsOri.origin: Scandia, the Latin name for Scandinavia

elementsOri.name: Titanium
elementsOri.origin: Titans, the sons of the Earth goddess of Greek mythology

elementsOri.name: Vanadium
elementsOri.origin: Vanadis, an old Norse name for the Scandinavian goddess Freyja

elementsOri.name: Manganese
elementsOri.origin: corrupted from magnesia negra, see Magnesium

elementsOri.name: Nickel
elementsOri.origin: from Swedish kopparnickel, containing the German word Nickel, 'goblin'

elementsOri.name: Gallium
elementsOri.origin: Gallia, the Latin name for France

elementsOri.name: Germanium
elementsOri.origin: Germania, the Latin name for Germany

elementsOri.name: Strontium
elementsOri.origin: Strontian, a small town in Scotland

elementsOri.name: Niobium
elementsOri.origin: Niobe, daughter of king Tantalus from Greek mythology

elementsOri.name: Ruthenium
elementsOri.origin: Ruthenia, the New Latin name for Russia

elementsOri.name: Palladium
elementsOri.origin: the then recently discovered asteroid Pallas, considered a planet at the time

elementsOri.name: Cadmium
elementsOri.origin: the New Latin cadmia, from King Kadmos

elementsOri.name: Antimony
elementsOri.origin: composed from the Greek anti, 'against', and monos, 'alone' (stibium in Latin)

elementsOri.name: Cerium
elementsOri.origin: the then recently discovered asteroid Ceres, considered a planet at the time

elementsOri.name: Praseodymium
elementsOri.origin: the Greek praseios didymos meaning 'green twin'

elementsOri.name: Neodymium
elementsOri.origin: the Greek neos didymos meaning 'new twin'

elementsOri.name: Promethium
elementsOri.origin: Prometheus of Greek mythology who stole fire from the Gods and gave it to humans

elementsOri.name: Samarium
elementsOri.origin: Samarskite, the name of the mineral from which it was first isolated

elementsOri.name: Gadolinium
elementsOri.origin: Johan Gadolin, chemist, physicist and mineralogist

elementsOri.name: Holmium
elementsOri.origin: Holmia, the New Latin name for Stockholm

elementsOri.name: Thulium
elementsOri.origin: Thule, the ancient name for Scandinavia

elementsOri.name: Lutetium
elementsOri.origin: Lutetia, the Latin name for Paris

elementsOri.name: Hafnium
elementsOri.origin: Hafnia, the New Latin name for Copenhagen

elementsOri.name: Tantalum
elementsOri.origin: King Tantalus, father of Niobe from Greek mythology

elementsOri.name: Tungsten
elementsOri.origin: the Swedish tung sten, 'heavy stone' (W is wolfram, the old name of the tungsten mineral wolframite)[3]

elementsOri.name: Rhenium
elementsOri.origin: Rhenus, the Latin name for the river Rhine

elementsOri.name: Iridium
elementsOri.origin: Iris, the Greek goddess of the rainbow

elementsOri.name: Mercury
elementsOri.origin: the New Latin name mercurius, named after the Roman god (Hg from former name hydrargyrum, from Greek hydr-, 'water', and argyros, 'silver')

elementsOri.name: Polonium
elementsOri.origin: Polonia, the New Latin name for Poland

elementsOri.name: Radon
elementsOri.origin: From radium, as it was first detected as an emission from radium during radioactive decay

elementsOri.name: Francium
elementsOri.origin: Francia, the New Latin name for France

elementsOri.name: Thorium
elementsOri.origin: Thor, the Scandinavian god of thunder

elementsOri.name: Protactinium
elementsOri.origin: the Greek protos, 'first', and actinium, which is produced through the radioactive decay of protactinium

elementsOri.name: Uranium
elementsOri.origin: Uranus, the seventh planet in the Solar System

elementsOri.name: Neptunium
elementsOri.origin: Neptune, the eighth planet in the Solar System

elementsOri.name: Plutonium
elementsOri.origin: Pluto, a dwarf planet in the Solar System

elementsOri.name: Americium
elementsOri.origin: America, as the element was first synthesized in the USA

elementsOri.name: Curium
elementsOri.origin: Pierre Curie, a physicist, and Marie Curie, a physicist and chemist

elementsOri.name: Berkelium
elementsOri.origin: Berkeley, California, where the element was first synthesized

elementsOri.name: Californium
elementsOri.origin: California, where the element was first synthesized

elementsOri.name: Nobelium
elementsOri.origin: Alfred Nobel, chemist, engineer, innovator, and armaments manufacturer

elementsOri.name: Hassium
elementsOri.origin: Hesse, Germany, where the element was first synthesized

elementsOri.name: Darmstadtium
elementsOri.origin: Darmstadt, Germany, where the element was first synthesized

elementsOri.name: Livermorium
elementsOri.origin: Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (in Livermore, California) which collaborated with JINR on its synthesis
